title: TV comedienne to host charity show
text:
0 comments 
CELEBRATED TV comedian and Bake Off star Jo Brand is to appear in a charity comedy evening on the Isle of Wight in aid of Island based Care of Destitute Children in India. 
She will be joined by special guest Edana Minghella who will get the event under way with music from her jazz combo. 
The show, An Evening With Jo Brand, takes place at Shanklin Theatre on November 28. 
A full house is expected to see the award-winning stand-up comedian, presenter, writer and TV personality in action. Winner of Best Female TV Comic at the British Comedy Awards in 2011, many of her routines feature self-effacing and celebratory statements about food and eating. 
The Minghella family have been integral to the success of the charity, which improves the life of destitute children now rescued and living safely in an orphanage near Calcutta. 
The late Gloria Minghella chaired the charity from 2008, a role now fulfilled by her husband Ed. Share article 
Their daughter Edana is the sister of the late Oscar winning film director Anthony, best known for The English Patient, and Robin Hood writer and producer Dominic.
